newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to announce PC program deal-WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to announce PC program deal-WSJ.

text.p: Microsoft Corp is expected to announce agreements with two companies to allow users of terminals hooked up to a server computer to run most PC programs, the Wall Street Journal said.
In its electronic edition on Monday, the Journal said Microsoft has agreements to license technology from Citrix Systems Inc and Prologue SA of France.
The Journal quoted unnamed industry sources as saying that Microsoft is expected to announce that the agreements will include so-called multi-user technology from the two companies.
That software enables many terminal users to access programs running on a server with Microsoft's Windows NT operating system.
Terms of the deal were not disclosed.
